title: Extended TAM-Based Educational Design to Enhance E-Learning Acceptance and Satisfaction During the Pandemic [Self-Directed]

context.prior_knowledge: Experience with foundational online learning tools (e.g., Zoom) and secondary-level science subject knowledge
context.additional_context: E-learning adaptability enhancement program for pre-service/in-service teachers in a smartphone-centric limited-technology environment

learning_goals: Learners can explain e-learning acceptance factors by analyzing core elements of the extended TAM model (technology efficacy, work-life quality, etc.)

Learners design three e-learning activities executable on low-spec smartphones (Android 8+, 2GB+ RAM) and offline environments within a one-week intensive course. They achieve an average of 4+ points (out of 5) on a peer evaluation rubric (content suitability, technical accessibility, educational effectiveness).
Learners can develop and submit as a project outcome an e-learning satisfaction measurement tool reflecting extended TAM factors

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
